assumption: Papain buyers will pay 3-7% transaction fees for verified suppliers
hypothesis: If we offer verified supplier listings with quality certifications, then papain buyers will accept 3-7% transaction fees because verification reduces their supplier risk and due diligence costs
success_criteria: 75% of surveyed buyers accept 3-7% fee range for verified suppliers
failure_criteria: Less than 50% acceptance or strong preference for fees below 3%
resources_required: Prototype platform, buyer contact list, survey design

assumption: Suppliers will join platform before achieving buyer critical mass
hypothesis: If we provide supplier onboarding incentives and marketing exposure, then suppliers will join the platform early because they need buyer access more than buyers need supplier options
test_method: Supplier recruitment pilot with early adopter incentives
failure_criteria: Less than 20 suppliers or high churn rate (>30%)
resources_required: Supplier outreach program, incentive budget, onboarding system

assumption: Quality verification system creates competitive advantage
hypothesis: If we implement comprehensive quality verification with industry-specific standards, then users will prefer our platform over general B2B marketplaces because papain quality is critical and poorly served elsewhere
test_method: A/B test comparing verified vs. unverified supplier listings
success_criteria: 80% higher engagement with verified listings, 60% preference over general platforms
failure_criteria: Less than 30% preference difference or low verification value perception
resources_required: Verification system development, quality standards research, user testing

assumption: Escrow services essential for international transactions
hypothesis: If we provide secure escrow services for papain transactions, then international buyers and suppliers will complete more transactions because payment security reduces transaction risk
test_method: Transaction completion rate comparison with/without escrow
success_criteria: 40% higher transaction completion rate with escrow services
failure_criteria: Less than 20% improvement or user resistance to escrow fees
resources_required: Escrow system integration, payment processing setup, transaction tracking

assumption: Digital marketing effective for papain industry reach
hypothesis: If we use targeted LinkedIn and industry publication advertising, then we can acquire papain industry participants cost-effectively because the industry is digitally accessible despite being traditional
test_method: Multi-channel digital marketing campaign with conversion tracking
success_criteria: Customer acquisition cost under $500, 15% conversion rate from leads
failure_criteria: CAC above $1000 or conversion rate below 5%
resources_required: Marketing budget, campaign management, tracking systems

assumption: Platform can achieve projected transaction volumes
hypothesis: If we successfully onboard target number of buyers and suppliers, then we can achieve $10M annual transaction volume by year 2 because market demand and platform adoption align with projections
test_method: Pilot program transaction volume tracking and extrapolation
success_criteria: Pilot achieves 80% of projected transaction velocity per user
failure_criteria: Less than 50% of projected transaction velocity or low repeat usage
resources_required: Pilot program management, transaction tracking, user engagement analysis

assumption: Logistics integration significantly increases platform value
hypothesis: If we integrate logistics tracking and coordination services, then users will increase transaction frequency and platform stickiness because integrated logistics reduces transaction complexity
test_method: Feature usage analysis and user satisfaction comparison
success_criteria: 50% increase in transaction frequency with logistics integration
failure_criteria: Less than 20% improvement or low feature adoption (<30%)
resources_required: Logistics partner integration, tracking system development, user feedback collection

assumption: Users will remain active after initial platform adoption
hypothesis: If we provide ongoing value through new features and network growth, then users will maintain active engagement because platform value increases with network effects and feature development
test_method: User retention and engagement tracking over 6-month period
success_criteria: 70% user retention at 6 months, 60% monthly active usage
failure_criteria: Less than 40% retention or monthly usage below 30%
resources_required: User analytics system, engagement tracking, retention analysis
